findings.title: Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in snippets.gtl?uid
findings.description: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) allows attackers to inject malicious scripts that execute in users' browsers, potentially leading to cookie theft, session hijacking, or phishing attacks.
findings.impact: This vulnerability has a high impact, potentially allowing significant data exposure, partial application compromise, or unauthorized access to sensitive functionality.
findings.evidence: XSS payload is reflected unencoded in the page response
findings.remediation: Implement proper input validation and output encoding. Use context-specific encoding for different parts of the HTML document, and consider implementing a Content Security Policy (CSP).

validation_details.proof: XSS payload is reflected unencoded in the page response

steps_performed: 2. Observe if the JavaScript alert with '1' is executed.

findings.title: Authentication/Session Vulnerability in sign in/sign up pages
findings.description: Session cookies are missing important security flags: Secure.
findings.impact: This vulnerability has a high impact, potentially allowing significant data exposure, partial application compromise, or unauthorized access to sensitive functionality.
findings.remediation: Set the HttpOnly flag to prevent client-side script access to cookies. Set the Secure flag to ensure cookies are only sent over HTTPS. Set the SameSite attribute to 'Lax' or 'Strict' to prevent CSRF attacks.
